If the self is different from the aggregates, the Buddha said that the self is different from the body, which the Buddha did not affirm, and is not explained in the sutras.
If the self is different from the aggregates, it can be in the aggregates and can also be everywhere.

If it is in the aggregates, when the body is cut or broken, the self should be visible, just as a mosquito in an udumbara fruit can be seen when the udumbara fruit is broken. The self in the aggregates is also like this.
If the self is different from the body, when the body is touched by cold or heat, the self should not be aware of it.
Moreover, if the eyes are plucked out, one should see things even more.
It is like this.
When the faculties are damaged, one should also be aware of sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects.
It is like this.
Moreover, if the self is different from the body, it can enter the body from this body to that body, and return to enter this body.
Just as a person can enter that house from this house, and return to enter this house.
If the self is different, it should be like this.
Furthermore, if the self is different from the aggregates, the self should not be born in various places.
If it is born in various places, it should be born in all places in a single thought.
Therefore, it should not be permanent, because it is always in the body.
Liberation is difficult to attain. If it moves in various places, it should not create karma.
If there is no karmic result, there is also no effort in karma. There is also no bondage or liberation, and no practice of meditation, and one should be liberated.
Such things should not be. Therefore, the statement that the person is different from the body can be refuted.
Thus.
Sammitiya Treatise, Scroll 1
